III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It was allegedly reported that while residing at Lincoln Center, a
youth witnessed other youth sexually assaulting each other on
multiple occasions. This sexual assault included penetration.
Investigation On 7/12/24, I emailed Complainant 1 to gather more information
pertaining to allegations.
On 7/15/24, I spoke to Administrator 1 at the facility.
Administrator 1 was told the allegations but did not have any
information to determine who the child/children may be.
Administrator 1 reported they have not had this type of situation in
their facility to her knowledge.
On 7/16/24, I spoke to Complainant 1 via telephone and
Complainant 1 provided Youth A’s name and phone number.
Complainant 1 was given information directly from Youth A and
did not have specific details. She did not have any new
information to provide concerning the allegations either.
On 7/17/24, I emailed Administrator 1 requesting information
pertaining to Youth A. Youth A was placed at the facility from
6/7/22-6/5/23. There were no grievances in his file. There are no
longer any youth in the facility that were placed when Youth A was
placed there. Administrator 1 reported that Youth A was a well-
behaved youth and followed the rules.
On 7/17/24, I left a voicemail and text message for Youth A.
There was no response. I called Youth A on 8/15/24 and spoke to
Youth A’s Parent. Youth A’s Parent was unable to provide any
more information than the allegations. Youth A’s Parent reported
she would have Youth A contact me.
2

On 8/16/24, I interviewed Youth A via telephone. Youth A was
adamant in that he had never seen anyone sexually assaulted at
the facility. Youth A reported he never saw any youth held down or
sexually penetrated by any youth. Youth A also reported he never
heard anyone talk about anyone being hurt in this manner, while
he was there.
Documents Reviewed:
• Youth A’s file did not have any grievances or incident
reports pertaining to sexual assault.
Analysis The agency is compliant with R.400.4126. There is no evidence to
validate the allegations.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
